notesStmt.note: Yosef Leṿi ha-Ḳatan: his name inscribed in partially illegible inscriptions: [5]306 [1546] (folio 1r). Inscription in Italian, dated: 19 August 1815 (inner front cover).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A daily prayer book (sidur), Italian rite, with the books of Psalms, Proverbs, Job, Five Scrolls, and the Hafṭarot for the entire year in the margins.

msItem.title: Special portions for Rosh ḥodesh, Purim, Ḥanukah, arba῾ah parashiyot

collation.p: 61 quires: i2 (folios 1-2), ii-lx8 (folios 2a-473), lxi8-2 (folios 474-479). Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script of the 14th century, partially punctuated. Daniyel ben Shemu᾿el ha-Rofe, dayan (judge) in Pisa, the first owner and probably the scribe: inscribed with his name (folio 3v).

decoDesc.decoNote: 2v1 full-page miniature of a coat of arms, in colours and gold.
10r1 full foliate border in colours and gold.
Numerous texts in decorated frames and inhabited by birds, animals, hybrids, in colours.
Many initial-word panels with pen-flourishing inhabited by birds and hybrids, in colours.
Many pen-flourishing and foliate motifs around passages sometimes inhabited by hybrids and birds.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Brown leather, tooled, with clasps. Spine: 'Siddur. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2736.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Chaim Horowitz: purchased from him on 26 January 1884 (inner back cover).
